summary: This is an email exchange from November 30, 2018, discussing legal proceedings related to Jeffrey Epstein. It references a motion for summary judgment in a malicious prosecution lawsuit filed by an attorney (who represented multiple victims) against Epstein in Palm Beach County Circuit Court. The email clarifies this is not the victims' lawsuit against the government or directly against Epstein, but a separate retaliatory litigation matter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the legal discussions; being sued for malicious prosecution by an attorney who represented his victims. Previously sued the attorney claiming involvement in fraud.

persons.name: Unnamed Attorney
persons.context: An attorney who represented multiple Epstein victims, now suing Epstein for malicious prosecution in Palm Beach County Circuit Court, claiming Epstein's prior lawsuit against him was retaliatory.

persons.name: Unnamed Law Partner
persons.context: The law partner of the attorney suing Epstein was convicted of fraud related to an Epstein business, which was the basis for Epstein's prior lawsuit against the attorney.

connections.description: Attorney represented multiple victims of Epstein and is now suing Epstein for malicious prosecution, alleging Epstein's prior lawsuit was retaliatory.
They were law partners; the partner was convicted of fraud related to an Epstein business.
The law partner's fraud was related to an Epstein business, which prompted Epstein to sue the attorney.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: A trial was scheduled for December 4, 2018, though the email seeks clarification on whether it is against the DOJ or Epstein, and in state or federal court.

events.title: Motion for Summary Judgment Filed
events.description: A motion for summary judgment was filed in the malicious prosecution lawsuit against Epstein, as referenced in the attached PDF.

keyFacts: An attorney who represented multiple Epstein victims filed a malicious prosecution lawsuit against Epstein in Palm Beach County Circuit Court.
Epstein had previously sued this attorney, claiming involvement in a fraud committed by the attorney's law partner related to an Epstein business.
The attorney's lawsuit alleges Epstein's prior suit was filed in retaliation for the attorney representing Epstein's victims.
A motion for summary judgment was filed in this case, and a trial was scheduled for December 4, 2018.
This lawsuit is distinct from the victims' lawsuits against the government or directly against Epstein.
